comments:
Here is an exception with the version in CVS:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.emf.ui.properties.sections.PropertySheetEntry.refreshChildEntries(PropertySheetEntry.java:528)
	at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.emf.ui.properties.sections.PropertySheetEntry.setValues(PropertySheetEntry.java:727)
	at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.emf.ui.properties.sections.UndoableModelPropertySheetEntry.setValues(UndoableModelPropertySheetEntry.java:263)
	at org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.PropertySheetViewer.setInput(PropertySheetViewer.java:943)
	at org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.PropertySheetPage.refresh(PropertySheetPage.java:454)
	at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.diagram.ui.properties.sections.AdvancedPropertySection.refresh(AdvancedPropertySection.java:170)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.views.properties.tabbed.view.Tab$6.run(Tab.java:229)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)

Any hints on how to duplicate the issue?

The stack trace indicates there is a descriptor in the cache without an id (?)

I debugged it. It is not the id is null. The array contains null entries. 
To work around, I add the follwing line:
        	if (childEntries[i] != null && childEntries[i].getDescriptor() != null) {

I canoot understand what's wrong and how reproduce it. But I do see some where there is a check if the entry is null.

Moving to 2.0 .

We need an example to duplicate this NPE.
The issue is likely in computeMergedPropertyDescriptors(). something is causing a null value to get into the list of child properties.
We have an example of this in SOA Deploy Tools. We can show that as needed. This is blocking our scenario in Constellation 1.5.
*** Bug 158868 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

patch for PropertySheetEntry
